metadata.name: OCTOPUS DELIRIUM #02
metadata.description:
The oldest known octopus fossil is about 296 million years old. Octopuses have three hearts, blue blood and can regenerate cut limbs. Two-thirds of an octopusâ€™ neurones reside in its arms. After mating, males wander off to die.

This incredible creature has been present in the mythology of several cultures around the world, often symbolizing regeneration or linked to the Underworld spirits. It has also been a powerful symbol of female power across cultures throughout history.

OCTOPUS DELIRIUM #2  is part of cross-chain series of works in which I explore the octopus as leitmotif.

___

Kika Nicolela is a Brazilian artist, filmmaker and independent curator based in Brussels. Having new technologies as tools, she proposes experiences that question the stories we make about the world and about ourselves. Since 2003, she has participated of hundreds of solo and group exhibitions at art institutions worldwide. She is represented by the Galerie Charlot (Paris/Tel Aviv) and Area35 (Milan).
